item.title: LV-Data v3.6.0.4
item.description:
Product: LV-Data v3.6.0.4
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 02 Jun 2023 15:05:22 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Collection of VIs to write and read TDMS, Igor Text Files (*.itx), text-based spreadsheet data files (*.dat), postgreSQL. Tools are also provided for uploading to and downloading from AWS S3.

Release Notes: [3.6.0]

- Issue #97: Read SQL.vi is now called Execute SQL Statement.vi; Result to Trace.vi is separate VI; remove call to Open/Close
- improved PGPASS file handling
- Issue #98: Improve ITX API: Read ITX.vim
- New API methods for handling map datatypes
- New Data Retrieve GUI
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Asylum AFM API v1.0.2.2
item.description:
Product: Asylum AFM API v1.0.2.2
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 25 May 2023 12:10:21 -0400
Packager: Joe Albro, Patrick Irvin

Description: This is a LabVIEW wrapper meant to facilitate the use of the text based Asylum Instruments ActiveX API. These are the lowest level commands. Please note that these commands may be out of date. This package will need to be updated as time goes on and new functionality is needed.

Release Notes: [1.0.2]
- Issue #11: Add function "Get Value", which will read from the Global Variables table. Note that this is distinct from "Read Value"
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Asylum AFM API v1.0.1.1
item.description:
Product: Asylum AFM API v1.0.1.1
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 28 Apr 2023 16:19:43 -0400
Packager: Joe Albro, Patrick Irvin

Description: This is a LabVIEW wrapper meant to facilitate the use of the text based Asylum Instruments ActiveX API. These are the lowest level commands. Please note that these commands may be out of date. This package will need to be updated as time goes on and new functionality is needed.

Release Notes: [1.0.1.1]
- Igor-specific functions are now stored in the Igor-API package dependency (Issues #5, #8, #9)
- note that some of these functions have new names (e.g. Asylum_OpenRefnum.vi --> Igor_OpenRefnum.vi)
- EnsureStringFormat icon updated (Issue #7)
- package install location and palette location now consistent with other LevyLab-related packages
item.dc:creator: Levylab

Description: This is a LabVIEW wrapper meant to facilitate the use of the text based Asylum Instruments ActiveX API. These are the lowest level commands. Please note that these commands may be out of date. This package will need to be updated as time goes on and new functionality is needed.

Release Notes: [1.0.1.6]
- Igor-specific functions are now stored in the Igor-API package dependency (Issues #5, #8, #9)
- note that some of these functions have new names (e.g. Asylum_OpenRefnum.vi --> Igor_OpenRefnum.vi)

item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Igor API v1.0.0.1
item.description:
Product: Igor API v1.0.0.1
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 27 Apr 2023 20:48:54 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin, Joe Albro

Description: LabVIEW wrapper meant to facilitate the use of the text-based Igor Pro ActiveX API.

Release Notes: [1.0.0.1]
- initial build
- This packages is based on Asylum-API v1.0.0.5, AFM Lithography f108670, LV-Data v3.5.2.3
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.13.0.5
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.13.0.5
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 26 Apr 2023 15:48:13 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.13.0]
- Issue #86:
- Wait for Magnet Setpoint.vi will stop on Finished? == True from Get Magnet.vi. It is the responsibility of the overriding instrument to control Finished?
- Wait for Temperature Setpoint.vi has a new control, tolerance. The overriding instrument API will need to be updated
- Issue #84, #26:
- Communication with instrument hardware should happen in the child process.vi. Handle Command can parse and discriminate commands, but it should forward messagses using Instrument:MessageToProcess.vi. The chil will respond with child:MessageToProcess.
- Open and Close are <b>disabled</b> in the instrument:process.vi. If you need this methods please implement them in the child's process.vi
- Issue #82: Change "Create Server SMO.vi" to make easier to call in non-Instrument Framework projects
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
